thread.title: New York-Based SoulCycle Files for Initial Public Offering
thread.title_full: New York-Based SoulCycle Files for Initial Public Offering - Bloomberg Business

author: Elizabeth Wollman
title: New York-Based SoulCycle Files for Initial Public Offering
text:
SoulCycle Inc., a chain of cycling workout studios, filed for an initial public offering with a placeholder of $100 million, an amount used to calculate registration fees that will change.
SoulCycle, based in New York, had 300,000 unique riders in 38 studios across the U.S. at the end of March, according to a regulatory filing Thursday. The chain started as a single, 31-bike indoor cycling studio in Manhattan.
Revenue climbed to $112 million in 2014 from $75 million in the year-earlier period, the prospectus shows. Net income increased to $25 million last year from $18 million in 2013.
The classes follow a signature format, including 35 to 40 minutes of riding, an upper-body strength series for five to eight minutes using hand weights, and a three-minute cool down.
Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Bank of America Corp. and Citigroup Inc. are managing the offering, the prospectus shows.
